Key Arguments: The legislation poses a serious threat to free speech.
It could negatively impact religious freedoms and public discussion of contentious ideas.
The exclusion of government from the legislation allows for potential bias and agenda-driven censorship.
Science and expert opinions are not always settled, and differing views should be allowed.
Open debate is essential for societal progress and should not be stifled.
Big tech companies may overreact to penalties by censoring or removing public forums.
Notable Quotes: This legislation allows governments to cherrypick the expert opinion that suites an agenda and label anything else as false and therefore misinformation.
Division occurs and society goes backwards when we cannot openly debate ideas.
Opening up big tech to big penalties will see them mitigate risk and over-react by removing public forums or censor them out of existence.
